body_html:
@ebrevdo
Thx for your answer. I've take a quick glimpse at the rnn_ops.py, it seems the dynamic_rnn call will auto clear the cells' state unless I wanna keep them isn't? So I can just set the reuse as True in the second call thus the code can run as I want regardless of the TF version?
body_text:
@ebrevdo
Thx for your answer. I've take a quick glimpse at the rnn_ops.py, it seems the dynamic_rnn call will auto clear the cells' state unless I wanna keep them isn't? So I can just set the reuse as True in the second call thus the code can run as I want regardless of the TF version?
body:
@ebrevdo 
Thx for your answer. I've take a quick glimpse at the rnn_ops.py, it seems the dynamic_rnn call will auto clear the cells' state unless I wanna keep them isn't? So I can just set the reuse as True in the second call thus the code can run as I want regardless of the TF version?
